comment: A move leading more often to tactical rather than positional play.
The Sicilian Defense.
Morphy preferred this move order to 2. Nf3 and 3. d4

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4
comment: Otherwise White has control of the center.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3
comment: Black can protect the pawn with 3... e5 since 4. Nxe5 would lose the knight to 4... Qa5+. However, White gets definite compensation after 4. c3 dxc3 5. Nxc3. Morphy's opponents rarely cared to risk this line.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6
comment: Because this move can give Black a backwards d pawn, it was condemned by the analysts for a long time. Only in the middle of the 20th century was it realized that Black's piece activity provides reasonable compensation for the backwards pawn.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5
comment: Threatening 6. Nd6+ Bxd6 7. Qxd6 with an advantage.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4
comment: Attacking the pawn again.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4 e5
comment: Now the d pawn is backwards: it will have trouble advancing to d5.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4 e5 7. Be3 f5
comment: A premature move.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4 e5 7. Be3 f5 8. N1c3
comment: White calmly develops and refutes Black's last move. There is no way for Black to stop the knight from going to d5 where it can then give a fatal check on c7. If 8... Be6 then 9. exf5 Bxf5 10. Nd5. Or if 8... a6 then 9. Nd5 axb5 10. Bb6 Qd7 11. Nc7+ and 12. Nxa8. If 8... Nf6 then 9. Bg5 a6 10. Bxf6 gxf6 11. Qh5+ is good for White.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4 e5 7. Be3 f5 8. N1c3 f4 9. Nd5 fxe3 10. Nbc7+ Kf7
comment: White could now play 11. Nxa8 exf2+ 12. Kxf2 Qh4+ 13. g3 Qxe4 14. Bg2 with an advantage in material.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4 e5 7. Be3 f5 8. N1c3 f4 9. Nd5 fxe3 10. Nbc7+ Kf7 11. Qf3+
comment: Instead White prefers a line with incredible complications. Morphy loved to take risks, and was leading in the match 5.5 to 1.5 (draws count .5).

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4 e5 7. Be3 f5 8. N1c3 f4 9. Nd5 fxe3 10. Nbc7+ Kf7 11. Qf3+ Nf6 12. Bc4
comment: Threatening 13. Nxf6 checking with the bishop. Black appears to have no defense

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4 e5 7. Be3 f5 8. N1c3 f4 9. Nd5 fxe3 10. Nbc7+ Kf7 11. Qf3+ Nf6 12. Bc4 Nd4
comment: A clever resource, attacking the queen and the pawn on c2.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4 e5 7. Be3 f5 8. N1c3 f4 9. Nd5 fxe3 10. Nbc7+ Kf7 11. Qf3+ Nf6 12. Bc4 Nd4 13. Nxf6+
comment: If now 13... Ke7 14. Nfd5+ Kd7 15. Qf7+ and 16. Nxa8 wins easily.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4 e5 7. Be3 f5 8. N1c3 f4 9. Nd5 fxe3 10. Nbc7+ Kf7 11. Qf3+ Nf6 12. Bc4 Nd4 13. Nxf6+ d5 14. Bxd5+
comment: Here Black should play 14... Ke7 leading to an extremely complicated position after either 15. Ng8+ or 15. Qh5.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4 e5 7. Be3 f5 8. N1c3 f4 9. Nd5 fxe3 10. Nbc7+ Kf7 11. Qf3+ Nf6 12. Bc4 Nd4 13. Nxf6+ d5 14. Bxd5+ Kg6
comment: This loses at once to a fine combination.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4 e5 7. Be3 f5 8. N1c3 f4 9. Nd5 fxe3 10. Nbc7+ Kf7 11. Qf3+ Nf6 12. Bc4 Nd4 13. Nxf6+ d5 14. Bxd5+ Kg6 15. Qh5+ Kxf6
comment: White cannot play 16. Ne8+ because of 16... Qxe8 17. Qxe8 Bb4+ 18. c3 Rxe8. After the obvious attacking move 16. Qf7+ Black plays 16... Kg5 and it is not easy to get at the Black king.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4 e5 7. Be3 f5 8. N1c3 f4 9. Nd5 fxe3 10. Nbc7+ Kf7 11. Qf3+ Nf6 12. Bc4 Nd4 13. Nxf6+ d5 14. Bxd5+ Kg6 15. Qh5+ Kxf6 16. fxe3
comment: Now the rook on h1 can come into the game. If 16... Qxc7 17. Rf1+ Ke7 18. Rf7+ Kd6 19. Rxc7.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. d4 cxd4 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Nxd4 e6 5. Nb5 d6 6. Bf4 e5 7. Be3 f5 8. N1c3 f4 9. Nd5 fxe3 10. Nbc7+ Kf7 11. Qf3+ Nf6 12. Bc4 Nd4 13. Nxf6+ d5 14. Bxd5+ Kg6 15. Qh5+ Kxf6 16. fxe3 Nxc2+ 17. Ke2
comment: and Black resigned. If 17... Nxa1 then 18. Ne8+ Ke7 19. Qf7#. If 17... Qxc7 then 18. Rhf1+ Kd7 19. Rf7+ Kd8 20. Rxc7 Kxc7 21. Rc1
